greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Similar to Cald's sequence (A006509), but move by the n-th composite instead of by the n-th prime.
example: The 4th term is 3 and the 4th composite is 9.
3 - 9 is negative, so instead add 9 to 3 to get 12, which becomes the 5th term because 12 is not among the earlier terms of the sequence.
mathematica: composite[n_] := FixedPoint[ n + PrimePi[#] + 1 & , n + PrimePi[n] + 1]; lst = {1}; Do[b = Last[lst]; p = composite[Length[lst]]; If[b > p && ! MemberQ[lst, b - p], AppendTo[lst, b - p], If[ ! MemberQ[lst, b + p], AppendTo[lst, b + p], AppendTo[lst, 0]]], {100}]; lst (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Nov 15 2013, after A006509 and _Robert G. Wilson v_ *)
results.author: _Leroy Quet_, Oct 13 2005
